caption: It is one of two monumental fountains designed by Jacques Ignace Hittorff, with the other being the Fontaine des Mers.  Inaugurated in 1840, it represents the rivers of France through allegorical figures. The fountain is adorned with statues symbolizing the major French rivers, including the Seine and the Rhône.  It's considered a significant element of the Place de la Concorde, one of the major public squares in Paris known for its historical importance and architectural beauty.  The fountain and the surrounding area are popular among tourists and locals alike. If you're in Paris, visiting the Fontaine des Fleuves can provide a cultural and historical experience.
Design is great, but still just a fountain.

Imagine walking into the heart of Paris, where the Fontaine des Fleuves and Fontaine des Mers stand tall on each side of the Obelisk at Place de la Concorde. These beautiful fountains are like artworks, designed by a clever architect named Jacques Ignace Hittorff. In the daytime, you'll see sculptures that celebrate rivers and seas with lots of details. But at night, these fountains light up, turning into something magical that makes the whole square feel special. Thanks to Hittorff, these fountains add a touch of wonder to the city's core, inviting everyone to enjoy their beauty, day and night.
It’s very refreshing and kinda oasis in the Paris city center when the weather become nice and sunny.

There are two monumental fountains at Place de la Concorde which flank the Egyptian obelisk. These are the Fountain of Rivers (Fontaine des Fleuves) and the Fountain of Seas (Fontaine des Mers) to the south.  These are the original works of Jacques Ignace Hittorff and were completed in 1840 during the reign of King Louis-Philippe. The two fountains are similar in chalice shape, form and composition with large stone basin pools, surrounded by figures of tritons an allegorical figures holding fish which spout water into the basins.  The fountains each have decorative figures representing crafts. The Fountain of the Rivers is dedicated to the Rhone and Rhine and displays figures of industry, harvesting flowers and crops and river navigation. The Fountain of the Seas, on the other side of the plaza, is devoted to the Atlantic and Mediterranean with accompanying figures - astronomy, commerce harvesting of coral, pearls and fish and navigation.  The two fountains are quite attractive and worth viewing, even during winter months when the fountains are not functioning. If you are visiting during the warmer months, they are a delight to view in the evening when lights illuminate the fountains.

On Place de la Concorde, a fountain dedicated to the Rivers of the North near Royal Avenue. There are two rivers, the Rhine and the Rhone, and under their feet are the products of these regions: “grapes, wheat, fruits, and flowers.” Then we also glorify human genius through river navigation, agriculture and industry. A second eye for the seas is on the southern bank of the Seine, and here lies the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea, where we can see “fishing, coral reefs, and pearls,” and small geniuses surround large statues “of seafaring, commerce, and astronomy.” The sight of the fountain running with water during the summer is more beautiful than in the winter, as it usually does not work in the winter
A beautiful fountain at Concorde. Well decorated and gives a special mood to the place.

While the two fountains share a similar fundamental design, they are not identical. The northern fountain closer to Rue Royale is inspired by Rivers, and the southern fountain closer to the Seine is inspired by sea.

It is an impressive fountain located in the heart of Paris, representing two of the main rivers of France, the Rhône and the Seine. This majestic fountain is a masterpiece of Baroque art, with sculpted details that capture the grandeur of the rivers and their importance to the history and culture of France.  The fountain is surrounded by a beautiful space that invites you to relax while enjoying its unique architecture. The water flows strongly, creating a serene atmosphere that contrasts with the bustle of the city. Its location is excellent, allowing visitors to enjoy a peaceful experience while exploring one of the most iconic areas of Paris.  It is an ideal place for lovers of art and history, as well as for those who are simply looking for a nice place to rest while exploring the city. La Fontaine des Fleuves is, without a doubt, one of those hidden gems of Paris that is worth discovering.
The fountain in Place de la Concorde, the entire square is empty and comfortable Encountering the sunrise in the east by chance, the spray of water shines brightly✨

It is one of two fountains located in the Place de la Concorde, designed by Jacques Ignace Hittorff and completed in 1840. The southern fountain commemorates the maritime trade and industry of France, and the northern fountain commemorates navigation and trade in the rivers of France
Very beautiful fountain on this magnificent Place de la Concorde. Place which was exceptional during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

the river fountain is made up of seated figures representing the Rhine and the Rhône, products from watered regions (grapes, wheat, fruits, flowers), statues of river navigation, Agriculture and Industry. the maritime fountain has six colossal figures representing the Ocean, the Mediterranean, fishing for fish, that of corals and that of pearls and shells. Swans mingle with three genies symbolizing maritime navigation, commerce and astronomy. For the creation of the statues adorning these fountains, the architect called on numerous artists: Jean-François-Théodore Gechter, Honoré-Jean-Aristide Husson, François Lanno, Nicolas Brion, Auguste-Hyacinthe Debay, Antoine Desboeufs, Jean-Jacques Feuchère, Antonin-Marie Moine, Jean-Jacques Elshoecht (known as Carle Elshoecht) and Louis-Parfait Merlieux.  They have the particularity of being made of cast iron, according to Hittorff's choice. They were to be made by the Parisian foundry Calla, but it was the Tusey foundry, in Vaucouleurs, which won the market. The cast iron was gilded for its most symbolic parts[2],[3].  Rostral columns 9.60 m high support ship's prows which adapted to gas lighting. They also evoke the emblem of the City of Paris. The same choice of foundry was made for the rostral columns, also in cast iron and produced at the same Lorraine foundry[4].  The allegorical statues of eight French cities outline the outline of the octagon imagined by Ange-Jacques Gabriel. The one evoking Strasbourg is draped in black from 1871, the date of the annexation of Alsace-Lorraine to Germany.
Beautiful fountain with golden parts. Elaborate.
One of the fountains located in the Plaza de la Concordia, with its twin on the other side and separated by the magnificent obelisk.
The twin sister of the Fountain of the Seas. It was recently renovated, the colors were revived, a great success, it is superb to look at.
Beautiful fountain dedicated to the seas with another twin dedicated to the rivers in the Place de la Concorde. Separated by the Egyptian obelisk.

It is a pretty fountain that occupies the center of Place de la Concorde. People took commemorative photos and wedding photos in front of the fountain. A fountain that breathes life into Place de la Concorde, which can sometimes feel empty.  The downside is that the surrounding Concorde Square floor is uneven and the location of the traffic lights is a bit ambiguous.
This fountain is of course more magical in the evening, but the charm works just as much in daylight. SACRED PARIS ♡

The Concorde fountains are two fountains located on Place de la Concorde, in the 8th arrondissement of Paris. Located on either side of the Obelisk of Concord, there is, to the south, the Fountain of the Seas and to the north the Fountain of the Rivers.
A picturesque fountain on the famous square where revolutionaries executed the king, queen of France, many aristocrats, as well as many figures of the Great French Revolution.

The river fountain is made up of seated figures representing the Rhine and the Rhône, products from watered regions (grapes, wheat, fruits, flowers), statues of river navigation, Agriculture and Industry.
The figures and colors of this font are simply beautiful.
